page.title: 06THE BLOW WELLS
page.content: Tetney Blow Wells cover an area of 32 acres.There is a total of 4 Blow Wells.They provide a source of fresh drinking water.When rain falls on the Lincolnshire Wolds it travels down towards the sea.Under pressure,the water escapes through weaknesses in the boulder clay and reaches the surface. As well as the actual Blow Wells,there are reed beds growing in what used to be a watercress farm,an area of grassland and numerous spinneys. This area is a nature reserve and may only be entered with special permission.
